node.title: Listar pets do usuário #39
node.body:

nodes.bodyText: @davidspader Ótimo PR, mas ele está apontando pra branch errada, pode apontar para a main?
troquei a branch, adicionei o Closes #39 ali tbm, se eu não me engano alguém tinha falado pra eu me colocar como Assignees na daily, mas não consigo fazer isso

@Lefel95 @k1nha
O que eu ainda preciso fazer?

node.bodyText: Não está usando usando o muxer do chi feito pelo @k1nha, mergear com a main e ajustar
Está faltando inicializar o Repository, Conexão com DB, UseCase e injeta-los, se mergear com a main vai ter já

Lembrando que o cmd/main.go é usado para subirmos testes rapidos localmente via CLI,  entao o que estiver aqui de inicializacao e injecao de dependencia, tem que estar em api/main.go, por que lá é a real entrada do programa
Tem alguma duvida para ler as linhas?
melhora o print do erro, lembre-se do %w
cara nao precisamos de um arquivo para cada controller
Coloco o método dentro do controller find.go então?

Cara tirando o package de email que ali deu ruim, recomendo chamar @k1nha
Tenho poucas mudancas citadas.
Mas vou falar algo aqui nao vou deixar passar, falta testes!
Como ja tive call de testes, e tem ate pacote de exemplo, da uma revisada e qualquer pergunta manda ai.
Mude para um erro de userID invalido, nao gostariamos de mostrar essa conversao pro usuario, entao mande algo como "invalid userID"

Adicione na resposta o status code 400.
Reference: https://chat.openai.com/share/1a144e3c-d26a-4ac5-b5a9-a8c31d7ec365
Para que esse controller?
Mudar para FindByUserID
Pq esse cara é novo? Não é do @k1nha ?
Mesma coisa do acima @k1nha
Mesma coisa do acima @k1nha
mesma coisa do acima @k1nha
Aqui tbm @k1nha
esse controller já estava no código, mexi nele só pro código voltar a rodar com as alterações que eu fiz.
esse FindPet é pra buscar o pet pelo próprio ID, eu também mexi nele só pro código voltar a rodar com as alterações que eu fiz.
Sim, foi o @k1nha que fez, não sei pq ta aqui
Sim, foi o @k1nha que fez, não sei pq ta aqui
Sim, foi o @k1nha que fez, não sei pq ta aqui
Acho que deu algum problema com o rebase
Devemos usar a mesma implementação do nosso pkg aqui
talvez seja valido colocar o "2006-01-02" em uma variavel p reutilizar, já que usamos elas em alguns lugares

Já que estamos no repository de pet, não faria mais sentido se o nome da função fosse: ListByUser
e também devemos usar nossa implementação de uuid, elá está dentro da pasta pkg/entity/id
aqui também devemos usar nossa implementação de uuid

devemos usar nossa implementação de uuid para parse
acho que o nome ListPetsByUser seria mais claro

boaaa! só mudar o uuid pro nosso package e tá top
talvez ser um pouco mais descritivo no nomes das funções

Bom PR, só algumas mudanças em nomes de variáveis/funções e utilizar nosso pkg de uuid
Lembra de usar o bot para criar o pr no nosso discord, fica mais facil pra comunicação
Fique livre para discutir as mudanças

Concordo!
Retirar o omitempty
Usa o nosso pkg de uuid
Renomear para TestListUserPetsErrorOnRepo

mockRepo.On("ListByUser", param ).Return([]*entity.Pet{}, errors.New("invalid userID"))
Retirar

node.title: Add model for iCubGenova11
node.body:
The `iCubGenova11` is an iCub 2.7, so we generated the model accordingly.

It also fixes https://github.com/robotology/icub-models-generator/issues/255 to ensure that CI is green. I manually run the CI to push the generated files in https://github.com/robotology/icub-models/tree/addicubgenova11 for testing @martinaxgloria .

nodes.bodyText: This is required to use the "modern" wholebodydynamics device on iCubGenova11 . fyi @martinaxgloria

I manually run the CI to push the generated files in https://github.com/robotology/icub-models/tree/addicubgenova11 for testing @martinaxgloria .

The CI failed with:
fatal: Remote branch addicubgenova11 not found in upstream origin

I forgot that I add to create manually the branch in icub-models, we should document this somewhere. I relaunched the CI in https://github.com/robotology/icub-models-generator/actions/runs/7461748396 .

This is required to use the "modern" wholebodydynamics device on iCubGenova11 . fyi @martinaxgloria

Thank you very much @traversaro!

It took some back and forth, but now the test branch has the commit that adds iCubGenova11, see robotology/icub-models@bcbae74 . Probably some change in pip dependencies also did some spurious changes to the files, but the core change is the new file for iCubGenova11.
@martinaxgloria @Nicogene feel free to approve if you tested this!

I was thinking, since it is the model for iCubGenova11, which has the legs disabled (and also the FT on them), could we exclude them also in the urdf? Or they will be enabled again in the future on the real robot?
Or, better, there's a way with wholeBodyDynamics to choose which FT sensors are used (for example with a parameter)? In this way, there's no need to exclude the FT of the legs and the feet from the URDF
cc @Nicogene @traversaro
According to this issue the only workaround so far is to modify the URDF. Then, I think we could disable at least the FT sensors of the lower body

I was thinking, since it is the model for iCubGenova11, which has the legs disabled (and also the FT on them), could we exclude them also in the urdf? Or they will be enabled again in the future on the real robot?

Good point, since the legs are electrically disabled I would remove them, it will fall if used in gazebo but maybe we make it just fixed?

I was thinking, since it is the model for iCubGenova11, which has the legs disabled (and also the FT on them), could we exclude them also in the urdf? Or they will be enabled again in the future on the real robot?

Good point, since the legs are electrically disabled I would remove them, it will fall if used in gazebo but maybe we make it just fixed?

We are not generating any Gazebo-loadable model (i.e. with a model.config) out of this model, so I think we should be safe on this.

According to this issue the only workaround so far is to modify the URDF. Then, I think we could disable at least the FT sensors of the lower body

Good point. Could we think to add a Python script or similar that does this to the model generated by simmechanics (and eventually by creo2urdf)? I guess it should be a task that can be easily done with the help of ChatGPT or similar LLM tech.

According to this issue the only workaround so far is to modify the URDF. Then, I think we could disable at least the FT sensors of the lower body

Good point. Could we think to add a Python script or similar that does this to the model generated by simmechanics (and eventually by creo2urdf)? I guess it should be a task that can be easily done with the help of ChatGPT or similar LLM tech.

See https://chat.openai.com/share/69784828-87f9-4a53-b805-55d02d66384b for a starting point (I do not have time to work on this further), not sure if it works. Once we have that, I am happy to integrate the resulting Python script in CMake.

According to this issue the only workaround so far is to modify the URDF. Then, I think we could disable at least the FT sensors of the lower body

Good point. Could we think to add a Python script or similar that does this to the model generated by simmechanics (and eventually by creo2urdf)? I guess it should be a task that can be easily done with the help of ChatGPT or similar LLM tech.

Ok for me!

@martinaxgloria @Nicogene Probably we can start merging this, and leave the disabling of the FT sensors in the future PR? In any case, this is for sure a net improvement over not having a model at all.

@martinaxgloria @Nicogene Probably we can start merging this, and leave the disabling of the FT sensors in the future PR? In any case, this is for sure a net improvement over not having a model at all.

Ok for me!
Ok for me 👍
I opened robotology/icub-models#229 for the follow up.
